moves.9. b4: The Pawn structure dictates that my play will lie on the Q side.
moves.9... Nd7 10. Nd2: Clearing the path for the KBP, and also preparing to swing the Knight to the Q side.
moves.10... f5 11. c5: Time to engage the enemy forces.
moves.12... Nxc5 13. Ba3: ...leaves me a Pawn behind, but has opened up the board for me to attack.
moves.13... Nxe4 14. Ndxe4: I'm not about to let Black establish his Knight in the center.
moves.16... Bd7 17. Bc4: I don't want to exchange any more pieces. It will weaken my attacking possibilities.
moves.17... Bf5 18. f3: On the other hand, I also don't want Black to seize a good diagonal with his B, so I guard the N rather than move it.
moves.18... Bxe4 19. fxe4: I complete the exchange, opening a file for my Rook in the process.
moves.21... h5 22. Qg5: No retreat now. I'm going all in for attack.
moves.24... Qd7 25. d6: The new threat is R-B8 dbl ch.
moves.25... cxd6 26. Qxg6: And Black resigns rather than be mated.
